text:
hey guys it's DJ BBQ and I'm her to show you how
to get perfect grill marks on your meat

scrub off crusted on food and other
debris by preheating your grill and

scrubbing with a grill brush the key
factor's to prevent sticking our clean

grill, oil and a high heat if your grill is not hot
enough you won't get the proper sear

marks on your steak wipe cooking oil
the grate using oil soaked paper or cloth

kitchen towel and tongs. Hold your hand three
to five inches above the grate and count

how many seconds you can keep it there if
you can't last more than two seconds
we've got the perfect temperature for steaks, 2-4 seconds means medium-high heat perfect for

burgers veggies and fish resist the urge
to poke prod or turn your meat too early

to ensure maximum grill contact for bold
marks and there you have it for perfect
grill marks you need a hot clean cooker
for more helpful tips click the link y'all
